title: Question 1
body:
Does the following applicant meet the basic eligibility requirements for the CPP retirement pension?

Ernie has been self-employed making widgets since 1980. Ernie has contributed the maximum CPP contributions each year he owned the business Ernie has recently sold this business and has issued a letter to Service Canada requesting a CPP retirement pension. Ernie was born in 1955.
instruction: Select an answer and click the Submit button to submit your answer

_feedback.title: Feedback
_feedback.correct:
✔ That’s correct

Ernie is eligible due to making contributions from self-employed earnings, making an application in writing, and being over 60 years of age.

_incorrect.final:
✖ Try Again

Ernie is eligible due to making contributions from self-employed earnings, making an application in writing, and being over 60 years of age.

title: Question 2
body:
David is receiving CPP Disability benefits and he requested the CRP while on the phone with an agent a month ago. He stopped working until his son was 8 years old, and he was the recipient of the CCTB.

Are any of these CRP eligibility criteria missing in this scenario?

_items.text: Received FA or eligible for CCTB
Was the primary caregiver of a child 0-7 years of age

_feedback.title: Feeback
_feedback.correct:
✔ That’s correct

Eligibility criteria, CRP requested in writing, is missing. CRP cannot be requested over the phone.

_incorrect.final:
✖ Try Again

Eligibility criteria, CRP requested in writing, is missing. CRP cannot be requested over the phone.

title: Question 3
body:
Can David receive all 33 weeks of extended parental benefits that he requested?

Explain your reasoning. What is the applicable BP extension required on this claim?
instruction: Type your answer in the box below. Once you are done, select Compare to check your answer.
modelAnswer:
Feedback

Yes, David can receive all of the 33 weeks of extended parental benefits that he requested. He has already received 10 weeks of CCB and then returned to work for 18 weeks so 28 weeks have been paid or deemed paid on the claim. This leaves 22 weeks that can be paid before the false 50-week maximum is reached.You must then determine how many weeks remain before the real maximum is reached.

22 weeks of extended parental benefits = 13 weeks of standard parental benefits. 10 weeks CCB +18 weeks work + 13 weeks standard parental at 55% = 41 total weeks. Therefore, 9 weeks can still be paid at 55% before the real maximum is reached.

According to Table 2, David could receive 15 weeks of extended parental benefits. He has already received 22 weeks and wants to receive only 11 more for a total of 33 weeks. You can extend the BP by 15 weeks to allow him to receive the entitlement he has requested.

title: Question 4
body:
Identify the effective date for the following applicant:

Joe is 60 years old on February 12, 2023. Application was submitted in June 2022. Joe requests benefits as early as possible.

_feedback.title: Feedback
_feedback.correct:
✔That’s correct

Joe applies at 59 years of age to start benefits when Joe turns 60. The first month of eligibility to receive benefits is the month after the 60th birthday which is March 2023.

_incorrect.final:
✖That’s incorrect.

Joe applies at 59 years of age to start benefits when Joe turns 60. The first month of eligibility to receive benefits is the month after the 60th birthday which is March 2023.

title: Question 5
body:
Ming is applying to receive a CPP Disability benefit. She stopped working to raise her children but did not request the CRP. She thought it wouldn’t affect her benefit and she doesn’t like completing forms.

Based on the CRP information you read, how might the CRP affect Ming’s CPP benefit?
instruction: Select all appropriate.

_items.text: CRP may help CPP benefit eligibilty requirements
CRP may reduce CPP benefit amounts
CRP may increase CPP benefit amounts
CRP may reduce taxes owing to the CRA

title: Accordions
body: How to display information and graphics in specific containers.
instruction: Below is an accordion, it is used to reveal more information in less space. Accordions are used for terms or like subjects.

_items.title: Click on the "+" sign to the right to open the accordion.
_items.body:
More information is revealed here:

  • When the accordion is opened, this text is visible.
  • This is a list, they are common in accordions.

_items.title: Closing accordions
_items.body:
Once you are done reading you can close the accordion by clicking the "-" sign.

  • Accordions can be long.
  • You can fit as much information into it as you need to.
  • Example text to demonstrate length.
  • More example text.
  • Example text to demonstrate length.
  • More example text.
  • This can go on as long as is needed, although if your accordion text is going to be incredibly long or complicated, consider making that information into a slide.

_items.title: Accordion with an image – Check it out!
_items.body: This accordion has an image inside of it.

title: Carousels
instruction: Below is a carousel, it is used to present graphical information. Specifically handy for walkthroughs or tutorials.
mobileInstruction: Below is a carousel, it is used to present graphical information. Specifically handy for walkthroughs or tutorials.

title: Video
instruction: For video, the multimedia player leverages the native HTML5 video tag. The MPEG 4 format (H264 codec) is the minimum requirement for video because it is the standard video format on many browsers. The multimedia player's timeline relies on the HTML5 progress element and uses a polyfill when the element is not supported.

_transcript.inlineTranscriptBody: Responsive design means you can create a course once but view it on a wide range of browsers, devices or operating systems. This is achieved by using fluid layouts to ensure the presentation of content is tailored to suit the size of the screen. This means you can start a course on your laptop and finish it later on your mobile or tablet. We call it Adapt

title: Navigation
instruction: The navigation bar is a component within the last block. Use the navigation block to introduce the next topic or page.

_transcript.inlineTranscriptBody: This is the Transcript that will have real text, This is an example :)

title: Video
instruction: For video, the multimedia player leverages the native HTML5 video tag. The MPEG 4 format (H264 codec) is the minimum requirement for video because it is the standard video format on many browsers. The multimedia player's timeline relies on the HTML5 progress element and uses a polyfill when the element is not supported.

_transcript.inlineTranscriptBody: Responsive design means you can create a course once but view it on a wide range of browsers, devices or operating systems. This is achieved by using fluid layouts to ensure the presentation of content is tailored to suit the size of the screen. This means you can start a course on your laptop and finish it later on your mobile or tablet. We call it Adapt

title: Headings and Accessibility
body: Using descriptive headings is helpful for all users but it is especially beneficial to people who use accessible technologies. Properly written headings allow users to quickly scan and navigate content on a page and help to determine the structure of the information being presented.

title: Navigation
body: In the Snap! framework we have several methods of navigating the course. There is back button in the menu bar, a sitemap in the menu bar, and Previous and Next buttons in the navigation bar at the end of each page. The navigation bar is a component within the last block. Use the navigation block to introduce the next topic or page.
instruction: Try using the different methods of navigating the course content

title: Icon Boxes
body:
Use Icons Boxes in conjunction with the Common Look and Feel icons. Each standard icon has an associated use and is outlined in the Style Guide section entitled Colours and Icons. Icon boxes are styled differently than regular text components to draw the learner's focus to special information. 

If the client receives any weeks of regular benefits in the initial BP, the BP cannot be extended to pay additional weeks of special benefits. In addition, the client must have received at least 1 week of that special BT in the initial BP to receive that same BT in the extended BP.

   Key Concept
If the client receives any weeks of regular benefits in the initial BP, the BP cannot be extended to pay additional weeks of special benefits. In addition, the client must have received at least 1 week of that special BT in the initial BP to receive that same BT in the extended BP.

title: Callout
body:
Every once in a while you need to draw attention to some extra information that does not fit into a Take Note or a Go To so you can use a Callout.

 

This Callout uses the div class="component note take-note".

title: Callout
body:
Every once in a while you need to draw attention to some extra information that does not fit into a Take Note or a Go To so you can use a Callout.

You can get this inverse theme by adding inverse-theme to classes.

This Callout uses the div class="component note take-note".

title: Visibility
body:
Initial Visibility (_styleBeforeCompletion): Determines whether the Trickle button is visible even while subsequent sections of the page remain inaccessible. Acceptable values are "hidden" and "visible".

Final Visibility (_styleAfterClick): Determines the properties of the Trickle button after it has been clicked. Acceptable values are "hidden", "disabled", and "scroll". "hidden" hides the button. "disabled" applies the "disabled" CSS class. The value "scroll" will cause the button to maintain its visibility allowing the user an alternative method for scrolling down the page by using the button (even after all sections have been revealed).

title: Enable Trickle
body: Enable Trickle (_isEnabled): Turns on and off the Trickle extension. Can be set in articles.json and blocks.json (and in course.json in the Adapt framework) to disable Trickle where not required. Also useful during course development.

title: Control the scroll
body: The Trickle extension makes it possible to control how the learner scrolls down the page, but what elements of a page can it be applied to?
instruction: Choose an option and select Submit.

_feedback.title: Feedback
_feedback.correct: The Trickle extension is applied to the "block" level to control the scroll.

_incorrect.final: The Trickle extension is applied to the "block" level to control the scroll.

title: Navigation
instruction: The navigation bar is a component within the last block. Use the navigation block to introduce the next topic or page.

title: Stack List
body: The Stacklist component displays list items one at a time when the learner clicks a button. Items fly into view from left and right alternately.

_items.body: This component is useful for making boring text list that little bit more interactive.
There is no limit to the number of items you can have.
Although if you have too many it will be a bit boring.

title: Hot Grid
body: When a learner selects an image, a pop-up is displayed that consists of text with an image.

_items.title: Task 1
_items.body:
• Provide the employer with the contact information for the Employer Contact Centre (ECC) to obtain the Utilization Report and Enrolment Sheet.
    • Ask the employer to complete the Enrolment Sheet and submit it to the Regional EI Work-Sharing Coordinator via courier (in a sealed envelope) or via the Data Gateway.
    • Emphasize the requirement to complete and submit the Utilization Report on a weekly basis via the Data Gateway.

Stay tuned as you’re about to learn about the Enrolment Sheet and Utilization Report shortly!

_items.title: Task 2
_items.body:
• Instruct the employer to phone the Employer Contact Centre (ECC) for instructions on registering for the Data Gateway.

Note: The ECC is also available to answer any questions the employer may have about completing the Utilization Report.

_items.title: Task 3
_items.body:
• Advise employer that upon request, a Citizen Service Specialist (CSS) can provide an employee information session at the workplace.
  • The CSS will provide the Appli-Web Reference Code to the employees.
  • The Appli-Web Reference Code identifies their participation in a Work-Sharing agreement.

_items.title: Task 4
_items.body:
If an employee information session is not held, you will obtain the Appli-Web Reference Code from the Regional EI Work-Sharing Coordinator and include it on the Important Notice for Work-Sharing Employees document.

  • Provide the document to the employer and employee representative.

_items.title: Task 5
_items.body: Discuss the scheduling of work for the Work-Sharing unit around statutory holidays.

title: Component title
body:
How can we describe each one of these three factors?

Let's find out!
instruction: In order to be able to continue, you must expand each section by activating the pin icon.

_items.title: PRESSURE
_items.body:
• Expensive tastes,
  • Addiction problems,
  • Living beyond ones means,
  • High personal debt or credit,
  • Substantial financial losses,
  • Undue pressure to succeed,
  • Greed,
  • A feeling of entitlement.

_items.title: OPPORTUNITY
_items.body:
• Using one’s position and authority as a means for engaging in fraudulent activity,
  • Capitalizing on lack of monitoring/oversight,
  • Using one’s ability to deceive using minimal effort.

_items.title: RATIONALIZATION
_items.body:
• “I do not care”,
  • "I am just borrowing the money”,
  • “Everybody does it”,
  • “I am not hurting anyone”,
  • “It is for a good cause”,
  • “It is not really a serious matter”,
  • “The organization can afford it”,
  • “I deserve it”.
